newsitem.title: USA: Giant to buy assets and stock of companies.
newsitem.headline: Giant to buy assets and stock of companies.

text.p: Giant Group Ltd said it agreed to buy 81 percent of the operating assets of Horizon Fabrics Inc and 81 percent of the stock of Hirschberg, Schutz & Co for $32.4 million in cash, notes and the assumption of certain liabilities.

The remaining 19 percent would continue to be owned by Giant's senior management and founders, James Cash and Jerry Spitzberg. After the deal was completed, a wholly-owned unit of Giant would own 81 percent of a new company that would be formed to consolidate Horizon and Hirschberg at the closing.

Horizon and Hirschberg supply specialty fabrics, ribbons and trims to the consumer segment of the craft industry; are headquartered in Union, N.J.; employ approximately 75 people; and are forecast to have revenues of about $50 million in the 1996 calendar year.
Completion of certain due diligence, regulatory approval and closing of the transaction are expected before year-end.
